skill.name: angular-component
skill.description: Create modern Angular standalone components following v20+ best practices. Use for building UI components with signal-based inputs/outputs, OnPush change detection, host bindings, content projection, and lifecycle hooks. Triggers on component creation, refactoring class-based inputs to signals, adding host bindings, or implementing accessible interactive components.
skill.summary: Create modern Angular standalone components with signals, OnPush change detection, and v20+ patterns
skill.author: analogjs

security_audit.summary: All static findings are false positives. The skill contains legitimate Angular v20+ component documentation with signal-based inputs, outputs, host bindings, content projection, and lifecycle hooks. The 91 flagged patterns are markdown code fences for TypeScript examples, not actual shell commands or security vulnerabilities.

low_findings.title: External Commands False Positive
low_findings.description: Static analyzer flagged markdown backticks as shell command execution. These are code fences for TypeScript/HTML examples in documentation, not actual command execution.
low_findings.confidence_reasoning: The backticks delimit TypeScript code blocks in markdown documentation, not shell commands

low_findings.title: Hardcoded URL False Positive
low_findings.description: Example URL in documentation flagged as hardcoded URL. This is a legitimate example domain for avatar URL construction.
low_findings.confidence_reasoning: Example URL uses api.example.com which is a standard documentation placeholder

low_findings.title: Weak Cryptographic Algorithm False Positive
low_findings.description: Analyzer incorrectly flagged lifecycle method names and import statements as weak crypto algorithms.
low_findings.confidence_reasoning: Keywords like 'init', 'destroy' matched incorrectly - no cryptographic code present

low_findings.title: System Reconnaissance False Positive
low_findings.description: Analyzer incorrectly flagged Angular component patterns as system reconnaissance.
low_findings.confidence_reasoning: Angular dependency injection patterns flagged incorrectly - legitimate framework code

content.value_statement: Create high-performance Angular components with signal-based reactivity, OnPush change detection, and modern v20 patterns for optimal rendering performance.
actual_capabilities: Create standalone Angular components with signal-based inputs and outputs
Implement OnPush change detection strategy for optimal performance
Use host bindings for component metadata without decorators
Build accessible components with ARIA attributes and keyboard support
Implement content projection with multi-slot support
limitations: Does not generate complete application scaffolding
Does not provide state management solutions like NgRx
Requires Angular v17+ for signal-based APIs

use_cases.title: Implement accessible interactive components

best_practices: Use signal-based inputs and outputs instead of class-based @Input/@Output decorators
Always use OnPush change detection strategy for optimal performance
Use host object instead of @HostBinding and @HostListener decorators
Implement accessibility with proper ARIA attributes and keyboard support
anti_patterns: Do NOT use standalone: true in Angular v20+ (components are standalone by default)
Do NOT use ngClass or ngStyle (use direct class and style bindings)
Do NOT use constructor injection (use inject() function instead)

faq.question: What Angular version is required for this skill?
faq.answer: Angular v17 or later is required for signal-based APIs. Angular v20+ is recommended for the latest patterns.

faq.question: Are the components SSR-compatible?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill includes afterNextRender and afterRender for SSR-safe DOM manipulation.

faq.question: Can I use RxJS with these components?
faq.answer: Yes, use outputFromObservable for RxJS interop with signal outputs.

faq.question: How do I handle two-way binding?
faq.answer: Use the model() function which creates both input and output for [(value)] syntax.

faq.question: Do components support lazy loading?
faq.answer: Yes, use @defer blocks with triggers like on viewport, on idle, on interaction.

faq.question: How do I query elements in the template?
faq.answer: Use viewChild and viewChildren for querying elements and components in the template.
